system.description:
This spell grants the caster knowledge of one item, place, or person. The amount of time required depends on the subject being studied.

Identifying an Item:

  • If the caster holds the item being studied, the spell takes [[/r 1d4 #Turns to complete Lore spell]] turns to complete.

  • The caster learns the following details:

    • Name of the item.
    • Method of operation and command words (if any).
    • Approximate number of charges (within 5 of the correct number).
  • If the item has multiple functions or command words, only one function will be revealed per casting.
  • The spell will not hint at additional functions beyond the one revealed.

Investigating a Place, Person, or Distant Item:

  • If the subject is not held by the caster, the spell takes [[/r 1d100 #Days to complete Lore spell]] days to complete.
  • Legendary topics may take the maximum amount of time.
  • Information may be revealed as riddles, poems, or vague descriptions.
  • For large places or powerful beings, the DM may reveal only general details.
system.effect: Reveals details of 1 item, place, or person
